channel.title: Comments on: Preparing a “Blobby” Object for Printing with Shapeways
channel.description: Intermediate in flow properties between solids and liquids; highly viscous.

item.title: By: StephaneAG
item.dc:creator: StephaneAG
item.description:
Thanks a lot !
I've digged through Blender's 2.6's docs already, but I was looking for examples on boolean operations & fixing normals ... ... so yup, you actually "made my day" ;p
Also, I will continue to read through the docs, but if you had hints/advices on the following, I'd be glad to know about it ;) :
*Best way to add thickness to a mesh ? ( extrude it or ... ) *Make sure a mesh is correctly "oriented" ( ex: mask facing "north" ) *Add little holes ( cylinder boolean op ? ) to sides ( left & right ) of a mesh ? ( ex:mask )
-> I'll do my duty, but if you could throw me an aknowledged-bone, I'd love that ;)
Well, I'll continue to read your posts, And I'm truly looking forward to reading from you
Keep up the good work ! +
item.content:encoded:
Thanks a lot !

I’ve digged through Blender’s 2.6’s docs already, but I was looking for examples on boolean operations & fixing normals …
… so yup, you actually “made my day” ;p

Also, I will continue to read through the docs, but if you had hints/advices on the following, I’d be glad to know about it ðŸ˜‰ :

*Best way to add thickness to a mesh ? ( extrude it or … )
*Make sure a mesh is correctly “oriented” ( ex: mask facing “north” )
*Add little holes ( cylinder boolean op ? ) to sides ( left & right ) of a mesh ? ( ex:mask )

-> I’ll do my duty, but if you could throw me an aknowledged-bone, I’d love that ðŸ˜‰

Well, I’ll continue to read your posts,
And I’m truly looking forward to reading from you

Keep up the good work !
+
